indications:
Indications 
(From Acamprosate: British National Formulary)
Acamprosate
name: ACAMPROSATE CALCIUM
cautions: Cautions continued alcohol abuse (risk of treatment failure)
side-effects:
Side-effects diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain; fluctuation
in libido; pruritus, maculopapular rash; rarely bullous
skin reactions
doses:
adult 18–65 years, body-weight
60 kg and over, 666 mg 3 times daily; body-weight less than 60 kg,
666 mg at breakfast, 333 mg at midday, and 333 mg at night

child 16–18 years (under specialist
supervision) [unlicensed], body-weight 60 kg and over, 666 mg 3 times
daily; body-weight less than 60 kg, 666 mg at breakfast, 333 mg at
midday, and 333 mg at night
